Time Warriors is a strategy game where you lead your army through history, from the Stone Age to futuristic battles. Upgrade your troops, build powerful bases, and use unique units and tactics to defeat your enemies. Master every era, outsmart your opponents, and rise to become the ultimate commander in this epic war game.

How to Play TimeWarriors

In TimeWarriors, your mission is to lead an evolving army through the ages, starting from the Stone Age. Your ability to deploy troops is directly tied to your food supply. For every three pieces of food, you can send out one soldier. This means you’ll need to manage your rations: stockpiling food carefully is your priority. At the start of the game, resources are scarce, but watching ads can give you a helpful boost, allowing you to send out more soldiers and gain an early advantage.

The key to winning battles is timing and strategy. Deploy your troops when you have enough food, overwhelming your opponent before they can strengthen their defenses. Early levels allow you to outpace your enemies by cutting off their stronger units, such as soldiers on horseback, before they even have a chance to leave their base. This tactic works particularly well in Level 1, where the enemy wields essential clubs in the Stone Age.

An example of soldier deployment is based on food at level 1:

1-2 pieces of food: No troops can be sent.
3 pieces of food: Deploy one soldier.
6 pieces of food: Deploy two soldiers, and so on.

As you progress into Level 2, the game shifts into the Farm Age, where your foes are equipped with shovels and better weaponry. To keep up, you’ll need to use the rewards you’ve earned to upgrade your army. Invest in advanced tools and weapons that match the technology of the age, but balance this with maintaining a steady flow of soldiers to ensure you’re not overwhelmed. The longer battles progress, the more critical it becomes to upgrade your troops and your base to increase food production and withstand enemy attacks.

Several upgrades can give you a significant edge in battle. A grindstone sharpens your soldiers’ weapons, allowing them to inflict more damage, while a war banner rallies your troops to fight harder as a unified force. You can also invest in faster food production to deploy soldiers at a quicker pace or increase your base health to hold out against enemy assaults.

Victory in TimeWarriors depends on finding the perfect balance between attacking, defending, and resource management. With each successful battle, you’ll move closer to mastering the game’s historical ages. From the Stone Age(70,000–20,000 BC), where tools and settlements were in their infancy, to the Farm Age (12,000–4,000 BC), where agriculture and domestication laid the foundation for civilizations, every level challenges you to adapt and evolve. Lead your army wisely, and you’ll rewrite history with your conquests!

More Games Like This

There's no reason to stop here. If you liked TimeWarriors, you'll want to browse our action or battle category for more of the same. Battle Arena is a fun game that requires a strategic approach, where you create your team from over 50 unique heroes, each inspired by iconic characters you know and love. You may also like Mirrorland, where you explore Mirrorland's enchanted world, filled with challenges and adventures.. Bloons Tower Defense is another one to bookmark: it's a casual game where you build powerful defenses to stop the balloon invasion in this iconic TD game.

How can I get more food in TimeWarriors?

You can buy food through points earned in TimeWarriors, but the easiest way to get a quick supply is by watching an ad.

How can I get past level 1 in TimeWarriors?

TimeWarriors is a strategic one-click game. To get past round 1 and all rounds, your objective must focus on destroying your enemy's base and not just individual soldiers. Deploy as many troops as possible straight to your enemy base before they even get a chance to approach yours.

Getaway Shooter is a chaotic two-player game where you race three others to the finish line. Your moves are limited, and you can only move by jumping left or right, making the race tricky! Pick up guns and other weapons along the way to use against the others. May the best player win!

How to play Getaway Shootout

You can only use the keys W and E to move your character: clicking them will orient the character towards either left (W) or right (E), while releasing them after a longer pressing will make it jump in the same direction. The concept of the game is that the four characters are escaping a dangerous situation, which might be a falling aeroplane, where you need to be the first to get to the parachute, but only the first one reaching the goal will be saved. So it’s fair to use all of the available resources to prevent the others from advancing, while keeping the focus on being fast and efficient in your moves. Easier said than done!

Use the time trial as a training to practice the eight different available maps.

Play solo or with a friend

This 2-player game created double the fun when you team up with a friend using the same keyboard. Don't have a partner to play with? The game is available in one-player mode. Choose one of the characters at the beginning of the game and jump right in.

Jump to move

You will literally be "jumping" in the game. Gameplay dynamics are limited to left and right ragdoll-like jumps, making it difficult to race to the finish. You will soon see that jumping left or right creates quite a chaotic scene! The degree to which you move depends on how long you hold in either direction.

Anything goes

There are multiple rounds in the race, each taking place in a different location. Race to the finish line and pick up weapons and upgrades as you come across them. Use your weapons to attack the other racers on your way to the end!

Character and weapons

There are multiple characters to choose from, with over 30 options. Characters will be equipped with weapons such as sniper guns, shotguns, bombs, etc., to protect themselves from opponents and obstacles - you are, after all, on the lam!

Features
Goofy ‘jump to move’ mechanics
Weapons and power-ups

Unlockable characters

Playground is an action sandbox game where creativity meets destruction in an open-ended cubic sandbox! Whether you’re building grand cities, orchestrating epic battles, or just causing mayhem, the possibilities are endless! What will you build or destroy first?

How to Play Playground

You start playing Playground by adding characters to your game. Click on the heart icon to choose from a variety of characters, including male and female zombies, male and female humans, pigs, and even hybrid characters like zombie-pigs. Some special characters can only be unlocked through upgrade rewards.

Next, click on the gun icon to access a wide range of weapons. You'll find everything from handguns and rifles to chainsaws, shovels, machine guns, and more.

For heavier firepower, click on the grenade icon. Here you’ll find high-impact weapons like dynamite, grenades, rockets, and other powerful explosives that can help you survive tougher waves.

Need to set up some defenses? Click on the cement block icon to browse materials for building protective walls. Options include bricks, grass, wood, asphalt, and other building elements.

Click on the shirt icon to gear up. Equip helmets, protective vests, and other armor to boost your survival chances.

The wooden crate icon opens up a collection of useful props like emergency cones, tables, chairs, computers, armoires, and more: perfect for customizing your environment or creating obstacles.

Use the map icon to navigate the playground and plan your strategy.

Gameplay Tip: When zombies touch humans, the humans turn into zombies, so position yourself wisely and keep your weapon ready. Your goal is to eliminate the threat and make your way across the playground as quickly and efficiently as possible.

More Games Like This

Epic Sword Battle! Fight in Arena is a 3D action sword-fighting game where you're going to clash in chaotic arenas filled with action and ragdoll physics. Swing your blade and become the ultimate sword master. Use your reaction and accuracy to win every fight! The faster and more accurate your strikes, the higher your chances of becoming an arena champion!

How to Play Epic Sword Battle! Fight in Arena

In Epic Sword Battle! Fight in Arena, you immediately step into the chaos of the arena armed with a sword in each hand. The only catch is you’re working with ragdoll movements, so you never have complete control of where your sword lands! Quick reactions and accurate strikes are key. Your goal is simple. You need to defeat every opponent and survive until the end.

In the early levels, you will face single opponents, but by level 3, you’ll battle two at once. Focus on taking them down one at a time, as fighting both simultaneously is risky. At level 4, speed is critical. The floor will rise and fall beneath your feet, and the shaky foundation means you can fall to your death before an opponent even reaches you. In level 6, lure enemies into the deadly rotating swords for an easy win, but be careful not to stumble into them yourself.

Fight Smart

Victory depends on timing, precision, and adapting to the unpredictable environment. Strike fast, dodge attacks, and use the arena hazards to your advantage. The faster and more accurately you fight, the closer you’ll get to becoming the ultimate sword master and arena champion.

Engage in epic battle against your enemies! Fight in the arena with your sword, block incoming attacks, and win ragdoll battles to become a true arena legend. Get ready to slash, dodge, and dominate the arena!

Tips

Focus on one opponent at a time to improve your chances of survival.

World Z Defense - Zombie Defense is a thrilling action defense game where players must fight against hordes of zombies trying to overrun the world. In this post-apocalyptic scenario, your mission is to defend cities across the globe by strategically placing soldiers with different weapons, each offering unique stats like damage, shooting speed, and reload speed.

How to Play World Z Defense

The world is in chaos, and only you can save it. World Z Defense puts you on the front line of a global zombie outbreak, and it’s up to you to save humanity. No pressure. You will start at an ammunition base, where you can recharge your ammunition and prepare for the relentless zombie onslaught. Zombies may be slow, but they’re persistent and will stop at nothing to break through your defenses.

To defend yourself, click, drag, and drop your character to aim at approaching zombies. Once you’ve aimed, your position is locked, and all your bullets fire in the chosen direction until you return to the ammunition base. Timing is everything—your ability to take down multiple zombies at once depends on careful planning and aim.

As you play, you’ll earn rewards that allow you to upgrade your character, improving crucial stats like reload time and firepower. These upgrades become essential as the hordes grow larger and faster, leaving you less time to react. If zombies break through your barricade, it’s game over—so don’t let your guard down.

Explore a map filled with different geographical areas, each teeming with zombies waiting to be defeated. Your strategy is key: try to line up as many zombies as possible in your line of fire, as you can only shoot in one direction when away from the ammunition base. Use your resources wisely to become a more potent fighter and save the world from the undead menace. You've got this!

Space Wars Battleground is an action battle game set in a faraway galaxy where battles are fast, numerous, and to the death. The game features numerous characters that you play with and against people from around the world to dominate the competitive leaderboard and reach the heights of galactic victory with the support of your fellow fighters.

How to Play Space Wars Battleground

At the beginning of each match, you start with zero experience points, putting everyone on an equal footing. To gain experience, you must deal with damage and take down enemy team characters, steadily building your strength as the battle progresses.

Once you've accumulated enough experience, you can spend it on purchasing new characters, each with their own unique abilities and playstyles, adding depth and strategy to your gameplay.

After each match, you'll also earn coins as rewards for your performance. These coins can be used to unlock a variety of weapons, character skins, and upgrades, allowing you to customize and enhance your arsenal.

The ultimate goal is to work with your team to eliminate 100 enemy characters first, securing victory and bragging rights in this intense, action-packed competition.

How to find your enemy

It's key to use the floor plan map in the top corner of the game, which shows you exactly where your opponents are hiding and, more importantly, where your allies are as well. You want to be strategic about where your support is needed and avoid shooting friendly fire. Coordinate your moves based on where you won't be ambushed, where you can help your team, and where you have the most chance to shoot your opponents.

Cat and Granny is a chaotic first-person action where you play as a clever orange cat determined to outsmart the new black cat that Granny brought home! Cause havoc by knocking over flower pots, scattering objects, and scratching up furniture—all while making Granny believe the black cat is to blame.

How to Play Cat and Granny

You’re a mischievous orange tabby with a knack for chaos—but you’ve got a plan. Blame it all on the sweet, unsuspecting black cat.

Explore a house filled with destructible items, set up the perfect pranks, and watch as Granny reacts to the growing chaos. Sneak around the house and look for breakable objects—lamps, potted plants, chandeliers, anything that can go crash! Wait for the black cat to wander nearby. Smash! Knock over the object while the black cat is in the area so Granny thinks they did it.

Granny’s watching. If she catches you in the act, she’ll give you a scolding. But if the black cat is close by, she’ll blame them instead—and you’re off the hook. Can you outmaneuver your feline rival and reclaim your rightful place as Granny’s favorite?

Tip

Granny’s house is full of boxes. If she’s getting too close, jump into one and hide! Make it in time and you’ll stay safe. Miss your chance, and prepare for a stern talking-to from good old Granny.

Features
Interactive environments packed with breakable objects
A unique twist—frame the black cat for your mischievous deeds
Hilarious reactions from Granny as she falls for your tricks
Simple, fun, and highly addictive gameplay

Unleash your inner troublemaker and take back your territory in Cat and Granny!

Mad Town Andreas: Mafia Storie is a third-person gangster game inspired by Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas. Shoot, loot and commit all sorts of mischievous actions to climb the mafia ladder!

How to Play Mad Town Andreas: Mafia Storie

The story begins with your character awakening after a terrible night, of which he doesn't remember much. Your first objective will be to discover what happened while running small crime jobs for a friend named Joe. Build up your reputation as a bad guy by running or driving through the large city and making as much money as possible by completing different objectives.

You start as a nobody and will have to figure out the most efficient way to earn credit within the ranks of the local mafia. Do you want to be ruthless and commit atrocious crimes or keep it simple, drive a stolen car and undertake protection rackets?

The map on the top left of the screen will help you find the spots in downtown that lead you to completing your tasks: these are marked by a yellow circle, both on the map and on the playing field. Each completed task earns you some cash and enables you to build up your status. Be careful: as soon as you commit a crime, the police will reach you and try to take you down!

The story of the mafia in this city is also interesting: you can vie for position against other criminal masterminds and try to take them down if you wish, or align with the ruling mob and try to get into it. As you progress, you will find your own path and make your own choices in this open world. You will have endless amounts of fun as the longevity of this game is fantastic.

The cityscape will help you feel immersed in the game as you drive and complete your tasks. If you enjoy GTA-style games, then Mad Town Andreas is the perfect choice for you. Why not create your own mafia story and try to become the most notorious person downtown?

Other popular titles

A different kind of driving experience can be tried with Eggy Car, where you need to protect the integrity of an egg while riding hills and bumpy roads. If you are into snowy slopes, you can try your luck with Snow Rider 3D, a game with simple mechanics that is very hard to master. A fun experience, but a very different one, can be offered by our puzzle 2048.

Immortal: Dark Slayer is a top-down action RPG that puts you in the armor of a Fallen Knight, battling to purge the realm of demons, the undead, and creeping chaos. Drawing inspiration from the punishing combat of Dark Souls and Elden Ring, it delivers the same gritty challenge, reimagined with a top-down perspective and streamlined controls. Whether you're a seasoned RPG veteran or a newcomer to the genre, this dark fantasy adventure offers a thrilling, accessible experience.

How to Play Immortal: Dark Slayer

It’s just you, your blade, and your courage—facing off against waves of enemies, including some terrifying monsters from the depths.

You begin armed with a longsword, but as you collect coins and gain power, you’ll unlock stronger weapons to aid your quest. Combat is intuitive: stand near an enemy and your sword will automatically strike. Some foes fall with one hit; others demand persistence and precise timing.

Avoid taking damage. If enemies land too many hits, your health will drain, and you’ll fall. Dodge, retreat, and strike smartly to stay alive.

Each defeated enemy drops coins—grab them to upgrade your stats, including:

Damage – Hit harder, destroy faster
Health – Increase your resilience
Speed – Move and dodge more quickly

Worship one of three gods to gain powerful passive abilities:

Dora, Goddess of Light – Heals a small percentage of your health every 0.5 seconds
Vlac, God of Death – Regain 7% health each time you kill an enemy
Egoism, All for You – Boost all attributes by 10%

There are several doors to unlock, but this can only be done when you have successfully destroyed your enemies. No level is complete until the last enemy falls.

Stick Epic Fighter is an action-packed, arcade physics-based fighting game where you are in control of a stick fighter to battle enemies in a dynamic, geometric world. Your mission is to evolve your character into an unstoppable force by unlocking powerful upgrades, mastering epic combos, and unleashing devastating fatalities that will destroy your foes. Conquer waves of enemies with precision and skill as you dominate each battle. Only after crushing every opponent will you unlock the portal to the next level, where even more significant challenges await. Sharpen your reflexes, perfect your strategies, and prove you have what it takes.

How to Play Stick Epic Fighter

You begin in a classic arcade-style side-scrolling screen, where you’ll quickly get accustomed to the game’s controls. Use the up arrow to jump, the down arrow to attack, and the left and right arrows for movement. Before long, you’ll encounter enemies—attack them by holding the down arrow to unleash a series of sword strikes. Holding down the attack key continuously lets you deliver multiple hits, which is essential since enemies require several strikes to be defeated.

Though you can jump and sprint past enemies to reach the end of the level quickly, you won’t be able to progress to the next round until all foes are eliminated. If you leave any behind, you’ll have to backtrack and take them out. Once every enemy is defeated, and you reach the final portal, your stickman will celebrate with a happy dance, signaling that you’ve successfully cleared the level!

As you advance, the difficulty ramps up with more enemies and tougher challenges, so stay alert and fast on your feet! Use the arrows for guidance on enemy locations and areas you may have missed. Throughout the course, prompts will also direct you to jump to high platforms or descend into lower areas.

Each round rewards you with points that can be used to purchase upgrades, boosting your power and making it easier to defeat stronger enemies. Plus, you can customize your stickman by changing skins, giving your hero a fresh look as you fight your way through each increasingly intense round!

More Games Like This

Keep the fun coming. Browse our action category for more games that pack a punch. If you liked Stick Epic Fighter, you might like House of Hazards, where you avoid traps and finish tasks faster than your friends; Getaway Shootout, a two-player game where you race three others to the finish line; or Cuphead, a boss battle where you control a warplane carrying Cuphead. Check out our arcade games for even more fun.

House of Hazards is a fun local multiplayer game where each player completes tasks around the house while avoiding hazards. How far will you get before one of your friends trips you up?

How to Play House of Hazards

Health and safety? There is none here. There are dodgy light fittings, misfiring taps, and flying toast slices trying to knock you down. This isn’t a fever dream. It’s the daily struggle for those living in the House of Hazards. Step up and see what menial household tasks you can achieve today.

We recommend that new players start with the Time Trial mode, as it will help you familiarize with the game and its controls.

Try to live your daily life

Ultimately, your goal is to accomplish some tasks inside and around your house. These are simple things - making coffee, checking the mailbox, watering flowers. But, the other house members will be waiting - watching for you to walk into their trap before you can do it.

Cause chaos for your housemates

Regular play can accommodate up to 4 players: two use a keyboard and two use a Gamepad. But you can also play on your own with up to 3 AI-controlled opponents. You'll have to escape tricks done by other players to prevent you from completing the tasks assigned to you but also cause damage to the other players to try and win the game.

If you’re in the position of causing hazards, there is plenty you can do to make your housemates' lives miserable. You can fire taps, toast, and lasers at them. Drop lights on their heads. You can even pick up their limp bodies off the floor and lock them in a chest!

Available characters in House of Hazards

You can use some regular-looking guys, 2 males and 2 females, to play this game. As you progress and accumulate experience, special characters will be unlocked for you.

Dom

Samantha

Robo Rob (needs to be unlocked)

Buster (needs to be unlocked)

Stick War is a classic strategy war game featuring stick figures. This original title was released in 2009 in Flash and is now available to play in your web browser through Ruffle. Wage war through several nations and bring peace to the continent through a fun, action-packed campaign!

How to Play Stick War

Click the campaign to start your Stick War journey! You can create units by following the short tutorial at the start. Each stick figure can be individually controlled. Your goal is to destroy the enemy statue and move on to conquer the next nation.

Classes
Archidonis - the way of the archer
Swordwrath - the way of the sword
Magikill - the way of the mage
Speartons - the way of the spear
Your Mission

You are the leader of a nation called “Order.” Your way of peace and knowledge means your people do not worship their weapons as gods. This makes you a mark for infiltration by the surrounding nations. Your only chance to defend is to attack first.

Your Story

In a world called Inamorta, you’re surrounded by nations devoted to their nation’s technology and struggle for dominance. Each society has developed its unique way of waging war.

Proud of their unique craft, these nations have become obsessed to the point of worship, turning weapons into religion. Each believes their way is the only way and is dedicated to teaching their policies to all other nations through what their leaders claim as divine intervention. As you will know it… War.

How to Play
Follow the Campaign

There's a long road of battles ahead! The Stickman World War campaign trail takes you through a diverse array of themes from apocalypse to cyberpunk and Star Wars. You must defend your base from enemy stickmen armed with a plethora of weapons and military vehicles. When the moment is right, go beyond enemy lines to bring their base crashing down. There are over 50 unique tasks for you to complete!

Enhance Your Military Might

You can buff the stats of your army and oil workers in the armory, making units stronger, more protected, and better at carrying oil money. The shop also provides temporary buffs in-game, making oil workers generate more cash or sending in carpet bombs on enemy turf.

Survive Endless Waves

The survival mode puts your strategic planning and the strength of your army to the test. The longer you can handle the torrent of enemy stickmen, the more money you'll earn for upgrading your units and base.

Take the Fight Online

Archers Arena is an exhilarating mix of action and skills that tests your precision, decision-making, and adaptability. It’s designed to provide a challenging and adrenaline-filled experience for players who thrive on competition and enjoy mastering their skills. This game promises a dynamic gameplay experience that blends skill progression, tactical combat, and exciting visuals, making it a must-play for fans of action games.

How to Play Archer's Arena

In Archer's Arena, precision is key as you face off in intense, one-on-one battles where you’ll carefully track your vitals like health, base damage, and headshot damage. The gameplay is simple yet challenging: hold the left mouse button to aim and release to shoot, but your movement is limited, you can only adjust your bow’s angle up and down, never your character's position.

Accuracy is paramount, with some rounds offering helpful guidance on where to aim. Each player takes a shot in turn, with the round continuing until one player runs out of energy. While taking a hit won’t cost you your life, running out of energy will cost you the round.

As you progress through multi-level challenges, you’ll need to prove your accuracy and adaptability, navigating diverse heights, angles, and obstacles. Upgrading your hero and arsenal will be crucial, unlocking new abilities and weapons as you gain experience points.

Prepare to face off against skilled opponents with ever-evolving strategies, testing your skill and creativity. Whether you’re fighting in dense forests or towering castles, each location brings new opportunities and challenges to keep you on your toes.

More Games Like This

We’ve got plenty of games to like this so you can keep playing. Run 3, an addicting, endless runner-type action game in which you play as a little grey alien. Squirrel with a Gun is another title to consider, a quirky arcade shooting game where you take on the role of a checkered squirrel armed with awesome weaponry and acrobatic moves. And if it's archery games you're after, there are two fan favorites to suit your whims: Narrow One, a fast-paced battle using your trusty bow and arrow, or Bowman, a game where you and an opponent take shots at each other.

Jacksmith is a crafting game where you forge weapons for soldiers and join them on the battlefield as they slay monsters. Build the perfect weapons to see the soldiers into battle and give them the greatest chance of success!

How to Play Jacksmith
Craft swords for battle

Jacksmith is similar to other Flipline games, such as Papa’s Cheeseria, but you’re crafting weapons for battle instead of building sandwiches! Start by molding molten copper into swords and hammering them before finishing them with a handle fit for the hands of a warrior.

Test them on the battlefield

After each day at the forge, your soldiers will walk into battle against various monsters and enemies, using the weapons you crafted. While they are in the throes of war, loot will fly out for you to claim. These items are usually gems to spend in the shop and precious metals to create with. Weapons with higher scores perform better in combat, resulting in more loot for you to use at your weapon creation station.

Unlock more weapons as you progress

Unlock new weapons to build as the days progress. Every new item must be constructed skillfully according to spec, whether bows, axes, swords, or cannons. These brave warriors will need more powerful weapons as the days move forward. Using higher-quality metals results in a more durable build.

Buy upgrades from Ganders

You can visit a hip ostrich named Ganders in his little shop of war to buy various upgrades for the metals you’re crafting using your gems. It’s a great place to splash cash after a long day of slashing and impaling beasts! You’ll find various handles and other visually pleasing items here that provide added benefits when used.

More Games Like This

Once you’ve mastered the art of Jacksmith, check out some of our other cool crafting or action games. Stay within battle gameplay with popular titles like Battleship. Explore a bit of survival action with Getaway Shootout. Test your shooting precision in a game of Rooftop Snipers.

Features
Cook up a range of weapons in your forge
Mold, hammer, and craft them to the highest quality for the best chance of success
See how well your weapons perform in battle based on your crafting skills
Catch loot during fights that help you build the finest weaponry
Purchase various accessories and items for your crafting needs

Tanks Arena.io: Craft & Combat is a thrilling PvP action tank battle game where you are combating intense tank wars with a vehicle built and customized by none other than yourself. You will get to challenge players from around the world, so be prepared for plenty of surprises and a variety of strategies from your opponent.

How to Play Tanks Arena io: Craft & Combat

Your goal in Tanks Arena.io: Craft & Combat is pretty much to destroy or be destroyed. The sky's the limit in terms of creativity and tactical prowess as you determine what kind of vehicle you will use to destroy your enemy. Start by building your ultimate battle machine. Pick from a variety of chassis, turrets, armor plating, and weapons to craft a tank that reflects your unique style—or even emulate legendary tanks like the T-34 or Leviathan. Once you've built your tank, the real action begins.

Your first challenge is against Tobi the Tower, a rookie opponent to help you get a feel for the battlefield. Earn rewards like coins, jewels, and new tank parts as you progress, which can be used to unlock upgrades and make your tank even mightier.

As you climb the ranks, you’ll face tougher opponents like Frank the Mole, each with their own strategies and strengths—some tanks are much bigger than you, but it's not the size that counts. Outmaneuver them by targeting their weak spots—aim for their wheels to disable their movement or flip their vehicle to expose vulnerable areas.

The key to victory is constant improvement. Keep upgrading your weapons, armor, and gadgets to stay ahead. A stronger tank means better odds of winning battles and dominating the arena.

Prove your skills by crushing opponents in the championships and advance to the prestigious Bronze Division. With each victory, you’ll climb the leaderboard, earning bragging rights and unlocking more rewards.

Strategic hits can turn the tide of battle. A well-aimed shot to your rival’s wheels can render them defenseless—so aim wisely!

How to Play Ninja Hands

In this game you can only see and control your character's hands while looking around. Use Q, W, E and R in different combos to initiate various skillful attacks. You can shoot fireballs, throw shurikens, use a samurai sword, and much more! This is your time to prove yourself as a ninja warrior.

Mine Blocks is a 2D Minecraft fan action game initially released in Flash. You can now play the game again, as it’s been rebuilt in HTML5 and features regular updates from the development team. Explore, craft, and create a world of your imaginings in this open-world playground!

How to Play Mine Blocks

Mine Blocks shares many features with Minecraft, including the cool pixelated visual style. However, the game also introduces entirely new ideas. Mine Blocks has two principal game modes: survival and creative. More recently, the "minigames" tab was added to feature new game modes.

Survival

Collect various materials to craft shelter, weapons, and sustenance. The materials combine with others to create new items. For example, using wood and stone to craft a wooden axe. Shelter and weapons are necessary to fight hostile mobs such as creepers, spiders, and zombies.

Creative

Creative mode is a sandbox where you’re free to roam and have unlimited resources at your disposal. You won’t lose health or die, and you can fly around the map by double-tapping ‘W’ or ‘Space’ to place blocks, items, and mobs wherever you please. In this mode, you can use your imagination to build epic structures, cities, worlds, and everything else.

Words of Wonders is a crossword puzzle where you connect letters to reveal hidden words. Test your vocabulary and find all the words to progress and reach more challenging levels. Will you become a master wordsmith in this delightful word game?

How to Play Words of Wonders

Words of Wonders is an engaging word puzzle game that combines the excitement of crossword puzzles with the thrill of word search. Players form words by connecting letters in a grid, unlocking hidden words,, and progressing through levels.

You'll see a grid of random letters when you start the game. Each grid represents a level; your task is to find words by connecting adjacent letters. You can swipe your finger over the letters in any direction (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) to form words. Longer words and more complex combinations may unlock bonus rewards, so watch for opportunities to maximize your word choices.

Connect the letters to form a word. It will be revealed if the word you formed is on the crossword grid. Not all words will be on the grid, so use the letters you have already discovered to ensure you create words that will fit the puzzle!

Completing the grid allows you to unlock the next level, which gets progressively more challenging. The difficulty increases with more letters and words to find, so keep your brain engaged as you move through the game.

Some examples include finding the words “WON,” “OWN,” “NOW,” or “TOP,” “POT,” or “OPT” from a set of three letters. Or a mixture of three and four-letter words to form “WALL,” "ALL,” and “LAW.”

If you find yourself stuck, there are hints and boosters available to help you out. These tools can reveal letters or help you find the next word, though they're limited, so use them wisely. There are also rewards for completing levels or discovering difficult words, such as coins or additional hints, which can help you advance further.

Progress through the levels and collect unique background images with each new milestone. The levels get more difficult by introducing longer words and more letters, increasing the chances of getting it wrong and challenging your vocabulary skills!

Some levels feature specific themes, like landmarks or animals, where the words you form are related to that theme. As you progress, you’ll unlock different "worlds" or locations, each with unique challenges and puzzles. You also get fun bits of info throughout, like learning that The Great Pyramid of Giza is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

The goal is to find all the words in the grid before you run out of moves or time. Each level has a set number of words to complete in order to progress to the next stage. You may also encounter bonus rounds or challenges that offer extra rewards when completed.

As you move through levels, you'll earn points, coins, and other rewards, which will help you advance in the game. Some versions of the game also let you compete against friends or other players, adding a competitive element to the experience.

With its relaxing pace and engaging gameplay, Words of Wonders is a fun way to challenge your mind and expand your vocabulary while enjoying an immersive puzzle-solving experience.

Enjoy a range of exciting and challenging word puzzles in Words of Wonders. The game features an easy starting point to suit players of all ages and experience levels. See how good you are at finding all the words and become a master wordsmith!

Game Tips

Use the letters you have already discovered as a clue to find the word
Use the hammer icon to reveal a letter of your choice
Click on the hints button to reveal a random letter
Earn gems to buy hints and reveal letters

Two popular choices to play next are Word Wipe, a word search game with a twist where you use letters from all around and in any direction; Word Scramble, a popular word game where you decode scrambled letters to uncover hidden words; or Word Search, a simple yet classic game offered in different languages.

Open House is a puzzle match-3 game where you're unexpectedly tasked with turning an abandoned residence into your dream home via one puzzle at a time. Each puzzle brings about new furnishings and upgrades to keep you hooked. You have options, so redesign rooms with your style choices, swap out furniture, and watch your estate transform from rags to riches.

How to Play Open House

You, Oscar, are fresh off a rough flight, and things couldn’t have started worse. Somewhere during the trip, all your belongings fell out of the plane. You beg Theo, the pilot who took you to this island, to turn back so you can find them, but he refuses, saying he has too many passengers. He takes off without you.

Trying to stay positive, you decide this might be the perfect chance to start over in your new beachside home. After all, it’s only a suitcase… and luckily, you were wearing your favorite shirt during the flight. Time to see your new place.

You greet your neighbor, who’s not exactly welcoming, then head toward your new home only to find it looks nothing like the pictures from the real estate listing. The porch is falling apart, the rooms are wrecked, and it’s clear today is not your day. You can’t help but wonder if you’re on some sort of prank show.

Your first quest is to remove all the covers from the furniture in hopes of finding a hidden camera. To do this, you’ll complete match-3 puzzles that appear on the screen. Each match earns points and helps you move forward.

As you work, you notice the place is so bad that it even has critters running around. It’s time to contact the real estate agency. You're sitting at your computer when the desk collapses. You’ll need to replace both the desk and the chair before you can write to Mr. Fraudley, the man who sold you this disaster of a house. You send him a message explaining the mess, and he blocks you immediately.

Just when you’re feeling hopeless, your neighbor Charles surprises you by finding your missing suitcases, but the purple flower, which means a lot to you, is still missing. He advises you to get a wardrobe to store your clothes. After that, you’ll need a good night’s rest, which means buying a new bed.

Between each home repair or furniture purchase, you’ll play match-3 puzzles to earn what you need. Every successful round brings you closer to fixing up the house.

You keep trying to leave the island, but something always stops you. In the meantime, you keep decorating, cleaning, and repairing. Over time, you might just discover that this wrecked beach house has the potential to become the dream home you never knew you wanted.

Mahjongg Solitaire is an online mahjong puzzle board game that features traditional rules and modern visuals. There are no shuffles, and the game is timed, but the game's pace is relaxed.

How to Play Mahjongg Solitaire

Spot the patterns

Mahjong is a tricky puzzle game. There are so many tiles, many of which look the same but feature slight differences. Along with the need to spot these patterns, you can’t move any pieces with both sides blocked. The left or right side needs to be accessible, at least.

Finding a couple of “free” tiles is the challenge here, with a tile-free being when there are no tiles on top of it. In addition, either its left or right side needs to be open. In this version of Mahjong Solitaire, you can look at the top of your screen to understand how many pairs of tiles are “free” to be matched, plus you can match the special tiles, those with a colored background, anytime.

Use hints when you’re stuck

Mahjongg Solitaire features hints if you get stuck, but unlike some other mahjong games, it does not have a shuffle feature. The games are also timed, meaning there is some urgency to how many tiles you can match.

When the game ends, you’ll get a score for the tiles you matched and a bonus for how far you got in the game before your time ran out.

Tile groups in Mahjongg Solitaire

Mahjongg Solitaire features 144 tiles divided primarily into three suits. The primary suits are:

Dots - feature circles
Bamboo - feature lines
Characters - feature Chinese characters

In Mahjongg Solitaire, you’ll also notice special tiles that can be matched even without the same image. These are highlighted in blue or green.

Mahjong Solitaire is an excellent choice for both beginners and regular Mahjong enthusiasts. However, there are many other titles in our collection of Mahjong games. Other puzzle games you may like include board games such as 2048, Rummikub, and Ludo.

Chess Free is an online puzzle chess game where you can compete against players worldwide in exciting one-on-one matches. Challenge yourself by outsmarting opponents of various skill levels to strengthen yours. If you prefer to play solo, level up your abilities against the computer, choosing from a range of difficulty settings—from beginner to World Champion. Whether you're just learning the game or aiming for grandmaster status, interactive hints help refine your moves to get you there.

How to Play Chess Free

Chess Free follows the classic rules of chess. The objective is to checkmate your opponent's king, meaning it is in a position to be captured and cannot escape.

You can play against the computer, compete online with real players, or share the same screen with a friend. With 18 difficulty levels ranging from Beginner to World Champion, you can play based on your level.

Depending on your level, you can choose a "handicap," so you have a bit of an advantage. You can also enable hints and interactive tips to help guide you throughout.

The rules are basic—players take turns moving their pieces. Pawns move forward but capture diagonally, knights move in an L-shape, and other pieces have unique movement patterns. Strategy is key in chess. Protect your pieces, control the center of the board, and anticipate your opponent's moves. The game ends when one player's king is checkmated, resulting in a win or if a draw occurs under certain conditions.

In chess, a draw is a result where neither player wins, and the game ends in a tie. This can happen for several reasons, such as stalemate (where a player has no legal moves but is not in check), repetition of the same position three times, 50 moves without a capture or pawn move, insufficient material to checkmate, or mutual agreement between the players.

Made a mistake?

No problem—use the move cancel feature to undo and rethink your strategy. After each match, detailed analysis highlights errors and suggests better moves, while the option to replay specific moments helps reinforce learning.

You can save your rating and pick different time control modes like bullet, blitz, and rapid. Customize the board and pieces to your liking, review your move history, and even express yourself with playful cartoon emotions as you interact with your opponent.

Special Chess Moves to Know

Castling

Castling is a special chess move involving the king and a rook. It’s only allowed if neither the king nor the rook have moved previously, and there are no pieces between them. Additionally, the king cannot be in check, and it must not move through or land on any square that is under attack. This move helps protect the king and connect the rooks for better defense.

Taking the pass

Taking the pass, or en passant, is a special pawn capture in chess. If your opponent moves a pawn two squares forward and lands next to your pawn, you can capture it on your next move as if it had only moved one square. Your pawn will take its place, but this capture must be done immediately.

Ludo King™ is a classic board game also known as Pachisi or Parcheesi. The objective of the game is to bring all of your four colored tokens to the designated home column.

How to Play Ludo King™

You can start an online game or play against the computer, with just one additional player or play against three opponents in a 4 player challenge.

Choose your color and then start the game. Each player will take turns to roll the dice.

Ludo Rules
roll a 6 to take your tokens out of the base onto the starting square. You must bring all the tokens out and move them towards home strategically.
when you roll a 6 you have the right to roll the dice again. If you get a 6 three times in a row you'll forfeit your turn.
rolling less than 6 means that your turn is over after your move.
if your token lands on a square that holds an opponent's token, their token is forced back to the base and you gain the right to roll the dice again.
squares with a star are safe landings: tokens on star-squares cannot be sent back to the base. There are 4 squares with a star on this board.
when the same player has two tokens on the same square, those form a block, that other players cannot pass.
you need to get all four tokens to the home triangle to win the game. Tokens can only enter the triangle on exact dice rolls.
History and features of Ludo King™

Being one of the top games played worldwide, Ludo King™ has been rated as the best casual game in the board games genre. Ludo King™ is a cross-platform multiplayer game available on Desktop Android, iOS, and HTML5. The modes available are Online Multiplayer and Computer Mode.

Ludo King™ is the digital version of the classical royal game Pachisi. It was played as an indoor game in the courts of Indian Kings. Play the age-old board game with great design and features!

Ludo King™ follows the same rules as the traditional Ludo game. The dice numbers and strategy have equal importance and winning depends upon smart moves of the tokens you make while moving towards home. Save your tokens from getting captured and race ahead of all opponents to become the Ludo King!

Ludo Around the World

Ludo has different names in different regions and countries like Fia, Fia-spel (Fia the game), Le Jeu de Dada (The Game of Dada), Non t'arrabbiare, Fia med knuff (Fia with push), Cờ cá ngựa, Uckers, Griniaris, Petits Chevaux (Little Horses), Ki nevet a végén, برسي (Barjis/Barjees). People also misspell Ludo as Loodo, Chakka, Lido, Lado, Ledo, Leedo, Laado, or Lodo.

Tower Swap is a clever puzzle game combining match-3 mechanics with addictive tower defense gameplay. Stop the dragons from reaching your castle by building your defenses through tactical tile-matching decisions.

How to Play
Build your defenses

Match 3 pieces of the same resource to upgrade them to a weapon or defense piece. When you have 3 of the same weapon or wall beside each other, you can merge them to create more powerful units. However, merging also means less coverage over the map, so sometimes you should delay the decision to merge.

Protect your castle

You have a limited number of swaps available before the dragons attack, so you have to use them wisely. Position your defenses so you can weather the attack! Before the boss round the game will show an arrow indicating the area where the drag will appear. Day 10 and day 20 are the first boss dragon levels, so you need to be prepared. Once you kill a boss, they release a large number of smaller dragons.

Combine resources

Combine 3 of these resources to build the following defenses:

Stone - creates a defensive attack tower
Gunpowder - builds a cannon
Ice - creates an ice wall
Logs - creates an attack turret
Gold - forms a chest containing swaps and sometimes other items like TNT and anvils to immediately upgrade resources.

All of the created defenses above can then be merged again to build an even more powerful unit.

Sign up and join a clan

It's worth signing up for an account in Tower Swap! It is a simple process and will allow you to build a custom avatar using extensive options, join a clan to compete, earn gold, and unlock chests with rewards. At the end of each game you'll receive gold coins that you can use to buy lives and open chests early.

More Games Like This

Four Colors lets you play the popular card game for free in your web browser. The aim of the game is to be the first player with no cards, similar to other Crazy Eights style card games. Play a game like UNO in multiplayer with 2, 3, or 4 players.

How to Play Four Colors

There are various strategies you can use to maximize your chances of winning at this multiplayer UNO-inspired game. The main principle is to get rid of all your cards before everyone else. You can do that by matching the color or number of the card placed down before yours. If you don't have a playable card, you must draw cards from the pile until you do.

When you have one card left, press the "1" button, otherwise you will be punished with two penalty cards!

Number cards

There are 108 cards and four colors in total. Number cards make up 70% of the total deck, with four colors each containing 19 cards. The cards span from numbers 0-9. As for the quantity of each card, there is one zero card, and two of every other number. The remaining 30% of cards are called action cards and wild cards.

Action cards

Action cards add an extra level of strategy to UNO. There are three action card types in an UNO deck. There are two of each action card in each color. These are:

Skip card - the next player in the sequence misses a turn.
Reverse - reverses the direction of play.
Draw two - the next player draws two cards and misses one turn.
Wild cards

There are two types of wild card with four of each one. They are:

Wild - lets the player choose what color to play.
Wild draw 4 - declare the next color to match, and force the next player to draw four cards.
Games Similar to UNO on CrazyGames

Since its release, there have been several versions of UNO released, as well as entirely new card games. Other popular family-friendly games include Gin Rummy Online And Ludo King.

About UNO

UNO is a card game developed by Merle Robbins in 1971. He sold the rights to the game for $50,000, to a company that was bought out by Mattel in 1992.

Over the years, it's grown to become one of the most recognizable card games. There are now 100s of themed variations of the game based on anything from football to movies, some with slightly different rules and special cards.

Four Colors is a card game very much inspired by UNO.

Piles of Mahjong is an engaging and relaxing puzzle game that combines the classic elements of Mahjong with a match-three twist. As you progress through the levels, you’ll need to clear stacks of tiles by matching three identical ones, but be careful—strategic thinking is essential to avoid getting stuck!

How to Play Piles of Mahjong

Piles of Mahjong brings a fresh twist to the classic Mahjong formula with some exciting new dynamics. The game has most of the same foundational rules as a classic game of table mahjong, but instead of simply matching two tiles, your goal is to match three tiles from a pile featuring a mix of familiar patterns like circles and sticks, alongside fun new additions like bird and panda heads. To make a match, you must select tiles by clicking on them, and they’ll move to one of the seven empty spaces at the bottom of the screen.

But be careful! If you fill all seven spaces without making any triple matches, it’s game over. Strategic thinking is essential to clear the pile and avoid running out of space.

The game offers helpful features to assist you when you’re stuck, but they come with a price. You can reshuffle the tiles with 300 reward points or by watching an ad, flip all the tiles face up for the same cost, or even auto-match tiles in the bottom row with 100 reward points or an ad.

To add to the challenge, you start with two chances to remove a tile from the bottom area. Once those chances are used up, you will need to spend 100 reward points or watch an ad to earn another set of removals. These are useful if you are close to filling up your bottom spaces or if you find some tiles to pair with no space to move them to.

With its engaging twists and strategic layers, Piles of Mahjong tests your puzzle-solving skills while adding a bit of pressure to every move you make!

Onet Connect is a puzzle connect matching game inspired by mahjong gameplay. Your objective is simple—connect pairs of identical images to clear the board completely, but don’t take too long—there is a clock ticking your chances to win away. Plan your moves carefully, and if you find yourself stuck, use the hints button to keep the game going. Challenge your speed and strategy in this timeless puzzle adventure!

How to Play Onet Connect Classic

In Onet Connect, your objective is to connect tiles by matching pairs. You get to choose what type of board you want to play on. Choose from cute animals, tasty candies, or juicy fruits, and keep matching until the board is fully cleared. Inspired by classic mahjong, Onet Connect takes a fresh approach to pairing games. Each mode comes with the same rules but provides a different visual twist, so you can switch up the theme while honing your skills.

You can match tiles that are side by side, and initially, you will have to do to begin making a bit of board space. Once you have some of the board clear, you can match any tiles that may not be side by side but instead have blank space between the two.

Quick thinking is essential, especially because there is a ticking clock breathing down your neck—but don’t worry—there’s a hint option to lend a hand if you get stuck!

If you’re new to Onet Connect or need a refresher on how the pieces link, simply hit pause and click the question mark icon. This feature provides a clear visual guide to help you understand the connection mechanics, ensuring you can tackle even the trickiest boards with confidence.

Winning a round grants you extra points to boost your score, as well as additional shuffles. These shuffles let you rearrange the board when you’re struggling to find matches, opening up new possibilities. Plus, you have access to three hints, each one showing two connectable pieces to help you out of tough spots. Use them wisely—they’re free but limited!

The levels in Onet Connect gradually increase in difficulty, testing both your speed and your strategy. As you progress, you’ll be challenged to match faster, spot connections more efficiently, and use your shuffles and hints more strategically. It’s the ultimate test of your concentration and quick reflexes, inviting you to keep improving and setting high scores. Dive in and see if you can master every mode, conquer the timer, and reach the highest levels in this addictive matching adventure!

How to Play BlockBuster Puzzle

There are a few tutorials throughout the game to help guide you with controls and strategy, but this may not be necessary as the game is fairly straightforward. You get a series of blocks in various geometric shapes placed on the side of the game screen. Click on the one you want to move and carry it to the game board.

Each geometric shape may or may not fit together on the main game board - this is where your strategic eye comes in. Place each geometric shape on the board in a position to get one full line of gapless blocks. When you do this, that entire line will disappear.

Various rounds will allow you to collect more points, as some blocks are bedazzled with jewels worth more. You may have prompted a few moves, like clearing the board or undoing your last move. Take the suggestion, as it usually gets you out of a jam.

Score points by performing combos, which happen when you clear more than one line with one move, and set your high score that you can use to benchmark your game the next time you try this puzzle.

Bloxorz is a tricky puzzle game that tests your logical skills and sheer brain power. The objective is to get the block into the square hole and avoid falling off the edge. Put your brain to the test and see how far you get!

How to Play Bloxorz

Use your arrow keys to move the block correctly through the level and into the hole. The goal sounds simple, but Bloxorz is a challenging brain game that gets trickier and more mind-boggling as you progress. There are 33 levels in total.

As the levels get tougher, new pieces of the puzzle are added to increase the difficulty. There are switches, special tiles, multiple blocks and various ways in which they are used to add complexity to the puzzle.

What are the Different Switches and Tiles?

There are 3 types of switch in Bloxorz. You have the circle switch that works when you land on it in any fashion, this is also referred to as a “soft” switch. X-shaped switches require you to land upright to activate. The third switch type looks like parentheses () and teleports your block to different locations, splitting it into two smaller blocks in the process.

There are also orange tiles which are more fragile than regular tiles. These will fall through if you try to stand up vertically on them.

Want Another Logic Challenge?

As well as being a tricky brain game, Bloxorz is an old-school classic from the Flash gaming era, lovingly restored through Ruffle emulation. If you’re looking for a new challenge, check out Cups - Water Sort Puzzle and Math Push.

Bloxorz Tips
There is a passcode in the top right on each level. You can use it to get back to that level.
Small blocks only work on the circle switch, and aren’t heavy enough to activate other switches.
Switches are used to complete a variety of actions, so make sure to observe carefully.
If you want the solution to each level, you can find it in the video on this page!
Developer

Bloxorz is created by Damien Clarke from DX Interactive.

Arrow keys to move the block.

Park Town is a captivating match-3 puzzle game where you restore a neglected city park to its former beauty. Solve exciting puzzles, decorate to your heart’s content, and fill the park with adorable animals from across the globe. Team up with friends, tackle thrilling challenges, and bring life back to the park in your own unique way!

How to Play Park Town

The city is in trouble, and the mayor needs your help! A young red-haired man named Kevin is convinced that you’re the only one who can restore the park to its former glory. If you succeed, you’ll earn the deed to the city and even receive a real panda! But hurry, because others want to replace the park with a parking lot!

The once-beautiful city has been neglected for too long. Prove your skills by rebuilding and revitalizing the park through exciting match-3 challenges. Keep making combos to clear levels and earn rewards to bring the city back to life.

You’ll match three or more identical items to clear the board, from flowers to limes, bringing vibrant colors to the game. As you complete levels, you’ll plant ornamental shrubs, add flowers, and clean up the park. Later in the game, you’ll earn powerful explosive items, which allow you to clear entire rows in one move. If you ever get stuck, helpful hints will guide you toward your next match.

Keep progressing, and the mayor will track your efforts: don’t let him down! There’s plenty of work to do, but with the right strategy, you can transform Park Town into a thriving, green paradise once more!

Thief Puzzle is a clever 2D puzzle logic game that puts your problem-solving and strategy to the test. You control a sneaky thief’s hand as it reaches for valuable treasures, but the path is filled with complex traps, laser security systems, and tricky obstacles. Do you have what it takes to outsmart each trap that comes your way?

How to Play Thief Puzzle

In Thief Puzzle, you're tasked with a series of sneaky heists in various comical settings. You'll start by testing your skills in simple situations: snatching a purse from an old woman seated on a bench or grabbing groceries from two unsuspecting women from a ledge. As you progress, the challenges escalate. You’ll even swipe a tourist’s suitcase while they admire the Eiffel Tower and outwit a rival thief to steal a money bag in a museum. There’s never a dull moment as you navigate your way through each clever scenario.

From beachside schemes where you steal a pearl from a shell to slipping into restricted areas by pickpocketing a key, every level brings new surprises. As the difficulty increases, you’ll find yourself pulling off trickier moves like swiping a diamond ring from a newly engaged couple while they’re lost in a kiss or lifting answers from a classmate’s test without getting caught by whirling fans. You’ll also have to outsmart guard dogs to steal car keys, drive away with precision, avoid TNT explosions, and—just for fun—snatch a toupee from the head of a party guest.

As the levels progress, you will need increasing sharp thinking and precise timing as you carefully plot your moves to avoid detection and snatch the prize. With every stage growing more challenging, you'll need to outwit elaborate defenses using clever strategies and creative solutions.

Sharp thinking alone won't cut it. You will need to calculate the perfect angles and find the shortest path to avoid detection. The puzzles are designed to challenge your wit and timing, requiring you to navigate obstacles and interact with dynamic environments. The slightest misstep could alert your target or trigger traps, so precision is key as you outmaneuver everything from dogs, furniture, and, of course, unsuspecting victims.

Screw Out: Bolts and Nuts is a classic puzzle logic game where your goal is to unscrew bolts from various shapes and sort them by color into the correct containers. Each level presents a new challenge that requires patience, logic, and careful planning to succeed. Be vigilant! The number of additional holes is limited, so you'll need to think a few steps ahead before making a move. Every action counts, and rushing in without a plan could leave you stuck! Once all the bolts are sorted correctly, you’ll complete the level and move on to even trickier puzzles. Can you master every challenge and become the ultimate bolt-sorting expert?

How to Play Screw Out: Bolts and Nuts

Your main goal in Screw Out: Bolts and Nuts is to fill all the screw containers at the top but be careful: if the extra (unmatched) screw slots fill up completely, you’ll lose the round.

At the top of the screen, you have a set of empty screw holders, each with a specific color. Below, you'll see various shapes secured by colored screws. Your task is to unscrew each shape strategically, so that when all its screws are removed, the shape falls away.

The trick? Only unscrew screws that match the colors of the empty slots above. Any screw without a matching color gets tossed into your limited "extra" container space. If that space fills up, and you try to unscrew more with no room left, it’s game over.

Key Rules:

Always have a place to put your screws.
Match screw colors to top containers whenever possible.
Once a container is fully filled, it refreshes with a new color, giving you more room to play, so try to fill them quickly.

Special Tools & Power-Ups:

Magnet – Instantly fills one container (1,500 points)
Drill – Adds one additional hole (1,200 points)
Hammer – Breaks and removes an entire shape (1,800 points)
Skip Level – Skip to the next level (3,000 points)

This game is a true brain teaser that tests your logic, timing, and strategy. Choose your screws wisely!

How to Play Skydom

Each level you play in Skydom has an objective. This objective typically involves clearing a certain amount of a particular object or gemstone. When you do, the level is complete, and you get rewarded! Some levels also put you in competition against other players online.

What's unique about Skydom is that every second level, you will have to challenge an opponent to get through and reach the next stage. So the game won't be as relaxed and "solo" as most Match 3 games, but there will be some tension and another player to benchmark against.

Progress down the Skydom path to new lands and unlock the Alchemist once you’ve earned 1,000 coins. This master of the elements will brew unique bonus pieces that become full bonuses when collected.

Nuts Puzzle: Sort by Color is a classic puzzle game where you sort various colored nuts onto screws until they are all the same color.

As you progress through the levels, the puzzles get trickier, requiring you to plan your moves carefully and think several steps ahead. With each successful sort, you'll feel a satisfying sense of accomplishment. Get ready to test your strategy and problem-solving skills as you work your way through increasingly complex and colorful challenges!

How to Play Nuts Puzzle: Sort By Color
Organize the nuts

To play Nuts Puzzle: Sort by Color, start by tapping on the nut you want to move, then select the screw where you want to place it. You can only place a nut on another screw if it’s either empty or if the top nut on that screw matches the color of the nut you’re moving. This simple rule sets the stage for the puzzle-solving challenge, as you’ll need to strategically plan your moves to ensure each screw ends up with nuts of a single color.

As you progress, the game introduces more nuts and a wider range of colors, making the puzzles increasingly complex. New challenges, such as hard mode levels, add an extra layer of difficulty by hiding the color of nuts until you move a piece from above them. These added twists will test your strategic thinking and problem-solving skills as you work through each level, striving to complete the puzzle with fewer moves and greater efficiency.

Use helpers

It’s at this point that you may need to use the undo, reset, and extra screw options, which are available on every level. However, you can only win extra screws from chests and from the winner's wheel. Clicking the screw icon adds an extra screw to free up more space. The undo button has a finite number of uses, but these are restored on each level. You can use the reset button to start the level over from scratch if you have no choice.

Bridge Builder Simulator is a physics-based puzzle simulator game where you are the key architect of a bridge over water. You don't have a large selection of materials to work with and often use metal planks, which have limited availability. The ultimate test in your bridge build is when you press the play button and an actual vehicle crosses your design. If it gets to the other side, your bridge is a success. If instead it collapses, it's back to the drawing board for you!

How to Play Bridge Builder

Put your engineering skills to the test in Bridge Builder, a game where creativity and precision decide whether your structures stand tall or crumble into the river below.

Each round gives you a new challenge. Drag and drop metal pieces from the circles and extend them as far or as short as you like. Be careful, metal is costly, and you have a limited amount to work with. If you run out of metal or make a mistake, tap twice on a piece to remove it.

If you are building a bridge over water, you will need strong support on each side. Try building two Y-shaped structures with a piece of metal connecting them. The support will come from the walls; without it, the structure will collapse.

Another way to build over water is to create a Y structure in the center of the bridge’s length. It may not be the most stable design and will strain some areas, but as long as the car can safely cross, the bridge is considered a success. The challenge is to get the vehicle across without the bridge breaking.

You can also experiment with two supporting triangles on each side of the bridge for added stability.

If you have stronger cables and a bigger budget, try building upward. Some levels include vertical concrete slabs you can use for support. Bridges like this might sway slightly since they do not have a solid foundation below them, and that is normal. Go big or go home.

These are just a few examples to get you started. The options are endless, and if your structure is not sound, you will quickly find out and always get a chance to redeem yourself.

You will begin building bridges in the city. As your architecture skills improve, you will unlock new landscapes such as waterfalls, canyons, and mountain ranges.

You can request a hint at any time. Hints will ask whether you want the bridge automatically built for you or if you would like to see a guide on how to build it yourself.

Spider Solitaire 2 Suits is a challenging Solitaire game limited to two suits and two decks of cards. Move the cards around the tableau so they are in order by suit and number. Take more cards from the pile if you get stuck. See if you can win at this tricky game!

How to Play
Basic Solitaire rules

The rules of Solitaire are simple, but it can be a tricky game to master. The objective is to successfully remove all the cards from the playing field by placing them in number order by their respective suit.

Move the visible cards around to create a complete set in order from King to Ace. The cards must be placed in the same suit, in numerical order. If you cannot move any card, you need to click the pile of cards that is face down to add a new card to each row. If you are stuck, you can always use the reset button to start from scratch! Can you master Spider Solitaire 2 Suits?

Spider Solitaire rules

Unlike basic Solitaire, Spider Solitaire is trickier. It features two decks of cards and 10 rows. Playing with only two suits ramps up the difficulty even further. Other than these limitations, the rules are the same as regular Solitaire. You must stack cards of the same suit in descending order on the tableau. You’ll win the game when all the cards have been put in order.

About this game

This simple Spider Solitaire 2 Suits game features a clean, retro interface. There are no hints, so you should be experienced at playing Spider Solitaire before jumping into this one. However, you can undo your previous moves or completely reset the game when you get stuck.

More Games Like This

If you are a beginner to Solitaire, you might want to try playing an easier variant of the game first. Klondike Solitaire is the most popular Solitaire game and features hints, making it much easier. You can browse the rest of our card games and hop into a popular title like Uno Online for more card-playing fun.

Color Match is a creative puzzle art color-matching game where you unleash your inner artist. Blend colors skillfully to bring 3D objects to life, turning each into a stunning work of art. With every stroke, challenge your creativity and enjoy the satisfaction of crafting vibrant masterpieces in this immersive and artistic experience.

How to Play Color Match

In Color Match, your goal is to match the color of an object presented to you using a series of available colors. The challenge is to mix and combine different colors until you reach the correct shade that closely matches the object.

You can only move on to the next round once you've matched the color to a high percentage. At first, if you manage to match 60% of the color, you’ll need to keep experimenting. At 70%, you're getting closer, but it's still not enough. When you finally reach 90%, that’s when you’ve nailed it!

Once you've mixed the right colors and achieved the exact match, you can apply that color to the object and compare it side by side with the original. This visual comparison helps you see just how close you were to the perfect match!

The objects you’ll need to match colors for include a variety of items like an avocado, a tomato, cherries, watermelon, and more. Keep matching and refining your color-mixing skills to progress further in the game!

Solitr is a puzzle card game, the online version of the classic solitaire game, ideal for endless hours of fun: the perfect way to unwind after a busy day!

Solitr lets you focus on strategy and relaxation as you lose yourself in the addictive simplicity of this beloved card game. And the best part is there is no cleanup since it's all digital!

How to Play Solitr

The objective of the Solitr game is similar to that of the tabletop card version of Solitaire—you must move all your cards to the four foundation piles located in the upper right corner of the screen, leaving none on the board.

The rules are straightforward: stack each pile of cards in ascending order from King to Ace of the same suit. Once you have a complete ascending order, you can place these cards in the upper right corner. There is a hidden stockpile at the top left of the screen, which you can choose to display one or three cards, but only one will be available for movement at a time.

You will want to strategically move the uncovered stockpile card onto one of the seven tableau columns, depending on whether it can be placed in ascending order. You can drag cards to move them onto the seven tableau columns or to the four foundations. Remember that the seven columns only allow for alternating colors to be placed in ascending order.

For building rules, cards in the foundations must be stacked by the same suit in ascending order, from Ace to King. In the tableau, cards need to be stacked in alternating colors, from high rank (King) to low rank (Ace). Additionally, any empty spots in the tableau can be filled with a King of any suit.

As the deck is shuffled in random order, you must carefully strategize to find the correct moves as you reveal cards one by one. This is the essence of the solitaire challenge.

You can move either single cards or piles of cards within the tableau, but you can only move cards from the waste pile. Whenever you expose a face-down card in a tableau column, that card will automatically turn face-up for you.

More Games Like This

If you want to continue playing more puzzle games, we have a vast selection, including digital versions of tabletop classics. Have fun at Yahtzee Online, Uno Online, Mahjongg Solitaire, Ludo, Rummikub, and many more. Game night can be every night with online versions of old classics.

What is the objective of solitaire?

The goal of Solitaire is to get rid of all your cards by placing them in ascending order from King to Ace in the stockpile.

How do you play solitaire?

To play solitaire, move all cards to the foundation piles by stacking them in ascending order from Ace to King while following specific building rules for the tableau. To win, you must prioritize moving cards from the tableau to the foundations whenever possible, as this opens up space for more moves and helps reveal hidden cards.

Tic-Tac-Toe online is a classic puzzle board game of naughts and crosses that never goes out of style! Whether you’re looking to challenge your wits against other players worldwide, test your strategy against a cunning computer opponent, or enjoy a friendly match with someone right next to you in local multiplayer, this game has you covered. So, get ready to place your X's and O's, and see if you can outsmart your opponent!

How to Play Tic Tac Toe Online

The strategy is the same as the classic pen-and-paper game. You can choose to be a naught or a cross, and your aim is to match 3 in a row to win the game, all the while blocking your opponent from being able to match 3 before you. There’s a basic level of strategy to the game that suits all players' ages.

In this version of Tic Tac Toe, you can play online multiplayer games or local games against the computer or a friend.

Set the right difficulty level

Tic-tac-toe is traditionally played on a 3x3 board. In Tic-tac-toe Online, you can expand that to a 5x5 or 7x7 board for a greater challenge and some exciting games! In these larger board sizes, you match 4 instead of 3 in a row, changing the game entirely.

Play online multiplayer

The online multiplayer game option for Tic Tac Toe is fantastic. There are two modes available: quick match and create a match. If you choose a quick match, you are automatically placed into a random game with another Tic Tac Toe Online player. You can battle it out and rematch them as often as you want.

More Games Like This

Tic Tac Toe is a family classic. It’s simple, and you can play it anywhere with a sheet of paper and a pen. Check out more family favorites in our board games section under puzzles. You can play Rummikub, Uno, Connect 4, Ludo, and many more fun free board games.
